thread.title: What to Expect When GM Reports Earnings Results
thread.title_full: What to Expect When GM Reports Earnings Results

title: What to Expect When GM Reports Earnings Results
text:
What to Expect When GM Reports Earnings Results By Amanda Gomez | 07/22/15 - 01:51 PM EDT 
NEW YORK ( TheStreet ) -- General Motors ( GM - Get Report ) is scheduled to report its 2015 second quarter earnings results before the market open on Thursday. 
Analysts expect a year-over-year increase in earnings per share and revenue for the second quarter of 2015. 
Analysts polled by Thomson Reuters estimate GM will post earnings of $1.08 per share on revenue of $40.62 billion for the quarter ended June 2015. 
Last year, GM reported earnings of 11 cents per diluted share on revenue of $39.6 billion for the second quarter. 
Additionally, Fitch Ratings increased its credit rating for Detroit, Mich.-based General Motors, to an investment grade of "BBB-" with a "stable" outlook. 
Shares of General Motors are down by 1.25% to $30.01 in afternoon trading on Wednesday. 
Insight from TheStreet's Research Team: 
General Motors is a core holding of Jim Cramer's Action Alerts PLUS Charitable Trust Portfolio. This is what Jim Cramer, Portfolio Manager and Jack Mohr , Director of Research - Action Alerts PLUS , had to say about the company: 
We have become incrementally negative on GM following the economic/market-related fallout in China, where GM derives a significant portion of its revenues. 
We are now seeing weakness not only in China but the U.S. and (of course) Latin America as well. We are inclined to sell into any relative strength. 
-Jim Cramer and Jack Mohr ' Weekly Roundup ' originally published 7/17/2015 on ActionAlertsPLUS.com .
